Class EarthServerGenericClient.AbstractTerrain

Abstract base class for terrains.
Defined in: Terrain.js.

Class Summary
Constructor Attributes Constructor Name and Description
 
EarthServerGenericClient.AbstractTerrain()
Field Summary
Field Attributes Field Name and Description
<inner>  
AppearanceDefined
Stores the created appearances' names.
 
materialNodes
Stores the IDs of the materials to change the transparency.

Class Detail
EarthServerGenericClient.AbstractTerrain()
Field Detail
<inner> AppearanceDefined
Stores the created appearances' names.
materialNodes
Stores the IDs of the materials to change the transparency.
Method Detail
calcNumberOfChunks(width, height, chunkSize)
Calculates the needed numbers of chunks for the terrain for a specific chunk size.
Parameters:
width
- Width of the entire terrain.
height
- Height of the entire terrain.
chunkSize
- The size of one chunk.
Returns:
numChunksX: number, numChunksY: number, numChunks: number
clearMaterials()
Deletes all saved material IDs. Use this function if you remove old material from the dom. E.g. for ProgressiveTerrain.
{HTMLElement} createCanvas(texture, index, noData, removeAlphaChannel)
Creates a html canvas element out of the texture and removes the alpha values.
Parameters:
texture
- Texture to draw. Can be everything which can be rendered into a canvas.
index
- Index of the model using this canvas. Used to give the canvas a unique ID.
noData
- NoData sets all pixels with the RGB value that is the same NODATA to fully transparent.
removeAlphaChannel
- Flag if the alpha channel of the image should be set to be fully opaque. texture No Data Value is found in the texture.
Returns:
{HTMLElement} The canvas element.
createChunkInfo(index, chunkSize, chunkInfo, currentChunk, terrainWidth, terrainHeight)
This function calcs the needed information to build and place a chunk of a terrain.
Parameters:
index
- Index of the model using the terrain. Used for creating IDs.
chunkSize
- The desired size (count of values) of one chunk per axis.
chunkInfo
- This parameter uses an object that will be returned by calcNumberOfChunks(). It contains the information about a terrain and its chunks (e.g. number of chunks on each axis).
currentChunk
- The index of the current chunk to be build.
terrainWidth
- Width of the whole terrain. Used to calc texture coordinates.
terrainHeight
- Height of the whole terrain. Used to calc texture coordinates.
Returns:
xpos: number, ypos: number, chunkWidth: number, chunkHeight: number, terrainWidth: number, terrainHeight: number, ID: number, modelIndex: number
createOneSidePanel(domElement, side, width, height, xPos, yPos, spacing, modelTrans, modelScale)
Function to create one side panel. Normally called by the createSidePanels():
Parameters:
domElement
- Transform node of the model.
side
- Side of the panel.
width
- Number of vertices of the side panel on the x axis.
height
- Number of vertices of the side panel on the z axis.
xPos
- Starting position of the side panel on the x axis.
yPos
- Starting position of the side panel on the z axis.
spacing
- Spacing of the model's shapes.
modelTrans
- Model transformation on the y axis
modelScale
- Models scale on the y axis
createSidePanels(domElement, spacing)
Creates side panels for a models's terrain.
Parameters:
domElement
- Transform node of the model.
spacing
- The terrain's shapes spacing value.
{Array} getAppearances(AppearanceName, AppearanceCount, modelIndex, canvasTexture, transparency, upright)
This function handles the creation and usage of the appearances. It can be called for every shape or LOD that should use a canvasTexture. It returns the amount of appearances specified. For every name only one appearance exits, every other uses it.
Parameters:
AppearanceName
- Name of the appearance. If this name is not set in the array, it will be registered. In the case the name is already set, the existing one will be used.
AppearanceCount
- Number of appearance to be created. E.g. the LODs use a bunch of three appearance nodes.
modelIndex
- Index of the model using this appearance.
canvasTexture
- Canvas element to be used in the appearance as texture.
transparency
- Transparency of the appearance.
upright
- Flag if the terrain is upright (underground data) and the texture stands upright in the cube.
Returns:
{Array} - Array of appearance nodes. If any error occurs, the function will return null.
{string} getColorSlide(side, width, height)
Returns a string with the color values in RGBA of one side.
Parameters:
side
- Which side.
width
- Desired with.
height
- Desired height.
Returns:
{string} - String with RGBA color values.
{number} getDemValueAt3DPosition(xPos, zPos)
Returns the dem value of the height map at a specific point in the 3D scene.
Parameters:
xPos
- Position on the x-axis.
zPos
- Position on the z-axis.
Returns:
{number} - The height of the dem.
{number} getHeightAt3DPosition(xPos, zPos)
Returns the elevation value of the height map at a specific point in the 3D scene. All transformations and scales are considered.
Parameters:
xPos
- Position on the x-axis.
zPos
- Position on the z-axis.
Returns:
{number} - The height on the y-axis.
{*} getHeightMap(info)
Returns a height map part from the given height map specified in the info parameter.
Parameters:
info
- Which part of the heightmap should be returned. info.chunkHeight, info.chunkWidth, info.xpos & info.ypos
Returns:
{*}
{number} getHeightmapHeight()
Returns the Height of the Heightmap of the terrain.
Returns:
{number}
{number} getHeightmapWidth()
Returns the Width of the Heightmap of the terrain.
Returns:
{number}
setTransparency(value)
Collects all material nodes of the terrain and changes each transparency attribute.
Parameters:
value
- Transparency value between 0 (full visible) and 1 (invisible).
